intro: Tapanhuacanga intermedia, commonly known as the Mexican moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes morning glories and other climbing plants. The plant produces small, pale yellow or greenish flowers that bloom in the early morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Tapanhuacanga intermedia is often found growing along stream banks and in moist, shaded areas.
